a vascular organ, developed within the uterus of most mammals during gestation from the chorion of the embryo and a part of the maternal uterine wall, that is connected to the embryo by the umbilical cord and that is discharged shortly after birth, which serves as the structure through which nourishment for the foetus is received from, and wastes of the foetus are eliminated into, the circulatory system of the mother; the placenta.

penalty of death by hanging a criminal by a rope about the neck; capital punishment.
ಗಲ್ಲಿಗೆ ಹಾಕು gallige hāku to put to death, as a punishment for a crime, by tying a rope about the neck and suddenly suspending the body so as to snap the neck or cause strangulation; to hang.

(fig.) to destroy the vital, essential qualities of; to destroy completely; ಗಲ್ಲಿಗೇರಿಸು galligērisu = ಗಲ್ಲಿಗೆ ಹಾಕು; ಗಲ್ಲಿಗೇರು galligēru to be put to death by hanging; to be hanged (as a capital punishment).
an upright frame with a crossbeam and a rope, for hanging condemned persons; gallows.
a man who hangs condemned persons to death.
= ಗಲ್ಲುಗಂಬ.
= ಗಲ್ಲುಗಂಬ.
a soft, shapeless clotted mass; a lump; a clot.
= ಗಲ್ಲಾ.
a pit filled with the juice of the leaves of the plant tanneṛs cassia (Cassia auriculata), made for tanning the leather.
to become thickened and be formed into clot or clots.
to come together in large group; to throng; to crowd.
to fall down as a shapeless mass, losing one's vital strength.
coagulated milk; curds.
(a crowd) to break up and disperse.
a small container used for drinking beverages.
a clear, transparent quartz; crystal; a piece of this cut in the form of an ornament.
a sound that creates an atmosphere of fear (as the incessant sounds made by insects in a very dark area).
the sharp, abrupt sound made by a dog.
ಗವ್ ಎನ್ನು gav ennu to be very dark and have insects making incessant sounds (creating a sense of fear).
a female cattle; a cow.
a man whose profession is making of baskets from bamboo, rattan, strips of wood etc.
(dial.) the quality or condition of being unable to hear; deafness.
